column5: Thanks Phil.  Yes the colour match was intentional. Brian sent me pictures of the reel requesting I match the wraps a close as possible.
No prob Phil,just dont forget the royalties for both the builder and I.  And yes,like Chris said,it was made to match the reel.

With this being my first custom rod,I was excited from the day I ordered it til todays pick up. I was totally impressed with Chris,s work. Get the reel on and it was a perfect match and the balance was amazing.  On our drive back,I have decided,I am going to get that fixed seat section, once I know where I want it.Just not yet though,I need to work some over time.LOL   Im a very happy fisherman. I,ll be on the river in the AM to give it her first trial hook up.  Thanks Chris, for a great rod.   PS,,,,,,,,,,Thanks for not putting that pink thread on.  talk about BRIGHT
Very nice Brian! Congrats on the new stick. I'm convinced you'll be very happy with it. A chromer on the end of that will throw that perfect balance right off.
Wow! Very nice looking stick you got there!
What a beauty B, you're gonna put us in 1st place with that thar rod
wow you can finally be proud of your rod  ..no,that don't sound right  you should have fun with that rod....that's better...LOL
Nice rod Brian!,being one of a kind sure has to be nice,personally detailed.
That's awesome Brian    Chris' work is one of a kind One word comes to mind.... EXCELLENCE
Very nice Brian, Chris builds em with heart and sole
Amazing looking rod there, I would've liked to see it with that pink thread though
Congrates on the new stick B....hope you catch quantity over quality though...since we are not on the same team  Nice work Chris!
Thanks guys.  Glad you're pleased Brian and I'm hoping you're out putting it through its paces right now.
Pretty cool Chris...........I'm still thinking about that CTS blank. Thought you might have done the pink though, it would have matched his eyes!........
Thanks John.  I considered using pink and Brian can tell you for sure I have lots of it.
Chris, very nice work there. Nice and clean on the cork. Brian can you post a pic of the butt end. If you don't mind sharing, what blank was this built on, and what guides did you use?   FHR

Just got in,and yes Chris,it was christen many times this morning.Post later as the kiddies are over right now.  Rick I left the rod in Chris,s hands. What he used,he,ll have to tell ya.All I know,it,s a great rod.  Heres a pic of the butt.

Hi Ric, thanks for the kudos. The blank is a 13'-6" CTS, 4-8 rating.  The guides were Fuji BYAG's.  Brian wanted a sliding ring handle that I fancied up a wee bit with two shades of brown rubberized cork at the ends with a little bit of red Amboyna burl inserted at the back end.   Looking forward to the report and your thoughts on the rod Brian.
Me two,Christmas is coming:clapping:
I was there,where were you??????????????  :wallbash:
I wanted to,but last nights activities made for a rough start this morning.We still have time,Don't we?.

Oh come on now,I washed my face when I got to the river,,,,,,,,,,,That woke me up.  I would like to add Rick.When I was doing my consultation with Chris,Mike (solopaddler was there) and they were talking so much jibberish about my rod,I said,JUST MAKE ME HAPPY. And I am.
Nice Brian, I didn't realize you went for the 4-8 cts....it's a sweet blank...you'll love it.
"Jibberish," I don't recall talking jibberish, are you sure you were paying attention.
Thanks!!!
Still think you should've gone with pink guide wraps...Pink always attracts steelhead!  Great job Chris
Awesome job Spiel and great shots Brian!  Did match the Rod colour to the Okuma raw II on purpose?  That is slick!!!  I may have to forward some of these shot on if that is ok Brian.  Phil
